expected_issues.description: High complexity visit billed for routine visit without multiple comorbidities or extensive management

documents.content: 32-year-old male presents for follow-up of minor rash on forearm. Patient is otherwise healthy, no chronic medical conditions. The rash has improved with OTC hydrocortisone cream. Physical exam: Small area of mild erythema on left forearm, no scaling, no vesicles. Assessment: Contact dermatitis, resolving. Plan: Continue hydrocortisone cream for another week. No further follow-up needed unless symptoms worsen. Visit duration: 8 minutes.

line_items.description: Office visit, established patient, level 5 (high complexity, typically 40-54 minutes)
